meanings.definition: To check in advance or beforehand.
meanings.sent1: I always precheck my luggage before going to the airport.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to precheck your work for any errors before submitting it.
meanings.sent3: The detective decided to precheck the crime scene to catch the culprit off guard.
meanings.sent4: She liked to precheck her schedule to avoid any last-minute surprises.
meanings.sent5: Remember to precheck your answers before handing in your test.

meanings.definition: An inspection or examination done before something else.
meanings.sent1: The security team conducted a precheck of all the bags at the entrance.
meanings.sent2: The precheck at the border helped streamline the immigration process.
meanings.sent3: The precheck of the equipment revealed a hidden issue that needed fixing.
meanings.sent4: The precheck of the documents ensured everything was in order for the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The precheck of the venue uncovered a potential safety hazard.
